title: Daniel Goddard reveals he is leaving The Young and the Restless
text:
He has played Cane Ashby on U.S. daytime soap opera The Young and the Restless since 2007.

But Daniel Goddard revealed on Thursday that he is leaving the show after 13 years, admitting he was left 'shocked' by the decision.

The 48-year-old actor announced the news on Instagram, sharing a photo of himself alongside co-star Christel Khalil, who plays his on-screen flame, Lily Winters.

'End of an era': Daniel Goddard (left) revealed on Thursday he is leaving The Young and the Restless after 13 years. Pictured with his co-star, Christel Khalil (right)

'My dearest, beloved friends... tomorrow is the end of an era, and so we humbly invite you to join us in watching The Young and the Restless for Cane and Lily's final episode together,' he wrote in the caption.

In an earlier Instagram post, Cane had shared the news of his departure 'with a heavy heart'.

He wrote: 'It is with a heavy heart that I share the news that I will no longer be part of the cast of the Young and the Restless.

Redundant: Daniel confirmed that the death of actor Kristoff St. John, who played Neil Winters, and Christel's decision to leave the show had resulted in his character being written off

'I am as shocked and gutted as you are... I almost didn't post but I felt that the most loyal and loving fans an actor could wish for deserved to know and watch the last story arc knowing the rich meaning behind it.'

Daniel then confirmed that the death of actor Kristoff St. John, who played Neil Winters, and Christel's decision to leave the show had resulted in his character being written off.

'I am forever grateful for the 13 years I have been a part of the Y&R family... but sadly it seems that without Neil and Lily there just is no Cane,' he added.

Resurrected: This is not the first time Daniel has departed The Young and the Restless, as his character was previously killed off in 2011 before being brought back by CBS

This is not the first time Daniel has departed The Young and the Restless, as his character was previously killed off in 2011.

But Cane's demise led to an unprecedented outpouring of support from fans and CBS eventually reversed its decision.

The Young and the Restless premiered on CBS in 1973 and is syndicated internationally.
